pli-tv-pvr1.1:1.1: _Praise to the Lord, the Perfected One, the Fully Self-Awakened One_
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.1: Where was that which is the first offence involving Defeat laid down by that Lord who knows, who sees, perfected one, fully Self-Awakened One? Concerning whom? On what subject?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.2: Is there there a laying down, a supplementary laying down, a laying down that has not (yet) occurred;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.3: a laying down (that holds good) everywhere, a laying down (that holds good only) for certain districts;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.4: a laying down that is shared, a laying down that is not shared;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.5: a laying down for one (Order only), a laying down for both (Orders);
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.6: plunged into which, included in which of the five recitations of the Pātimokkha;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.7: by which recital does one come to the recital;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.8: of the four fallings way which falling away;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.9: of the seven classes of offence which class of offence;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.10: of the six origins of offences by how many origins does (a monk) originate (the offence);
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.11: of the four legal questions which legal question;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.12: of the seven (ways for) the deciding (of a legal question) by how many decidings is it stopped;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.13: what there is Discipline, what there is pertaining to Discipline;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.14: what there is the Pātimokkha, what there is pertaining to the Pātimokkha;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.18: Because of how many reasons was the first offence involving Defeat laid down by the Lord?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.20: Who have trained themselves in the training?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.24: By whom has it been conveyed?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.1: “Where was that which is the first offence involving Defeat laid down by that Lord who knows, who sees, perfected one, fully Self- Awakened One?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.2: It was laid down in Vesālī.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.6: On the subject of Sudinna the Kalandaka’s indulging in sexual intercourse with his former wife.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.7: “Is there there a laying down, a supplementary laying down, a laying down that has not (yet) occurred?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.8: There is one laying down, two supplementary laying downs,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.9: for it there is no laying down that has not (yet) occurred.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.10: “A laying down (that holds good) everywhere, a laying down (that holds good only) for certain districts?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.11: A laying down (that holds good) everywhere.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.12: “A laying down that is shared, a laying down that is not shared?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.13: A laying down that is shared.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.14: “A laying down for one (Order), a laying down for both (Orders)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.16: “Plunged into which, included in which of the five recitations of the Pātimokkha?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.17: Plunged into the source, included in the source.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.18: “By which recital does one come to the recital?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.19: By the second recital one comes to the recital.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.20: “Of the four fallings away which falling away?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.21: The falling away in moral habit.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.22: “Of the seven classes of offence which class of offence?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.24: “Of the six origins of offences by how many origins does (a monk) originate (the offence)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.25: He originates it by one origin—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.26: he originates it by body and by mind, not by speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.27: “Of the four legal questions which legal question?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.29: “Of the seven decidings (of a legal question) by how many decidings is it stopped?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.30: It is stopped by two decidings:
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.31: by a verdict in the presence of, by the carrying out on (his) acknowledgement.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.32: “What there is Discipline, what there is pertaining to Discipline?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.33: A laying down is Discipline, the analysis (in the Old Commentary) is pertaining to Discipline.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.34: “What there is the Pātimokkha, what there is pertaining to the Pātimokkha?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.35: A laying down is the Pātimokkha, the analysis (in the Old Commentary) is pertaining to the Pātimokkha.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.37: Lack of self-control is falling away.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.41: Saying, “I will not act in such a way,” undertaking them for as long as he lives till the end of his life, and training himself in the rules of training.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.42: “Because of how many reasons was the first offence involving Defeat laid down by the Lord?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.43: Because of ten reasons was the first offence involving Defeat laid down by the Lord:
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.44: for the excellence of the Order, for the comfort of the Order, for the control of evil-minded men, for the living in ease of well behaved monks, for the restraint of the cankers belonging to the here-now, for the combating of cankers belonging to future states, for the benefit of non-believers, for an increase in the number of believers, for establishing the true _Dhamma_, for help with Discipline.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.46: Learners and ordinary people who are morally good.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.47: “Who have trained themselves in the training?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.48: Arahants have trained themselves in the training.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.50: The state of desiring the training.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.52: Those who know by heart the procedure of these.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.54: It is the Utterance of the Lord, perfected one, fully Self-Awakened One.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.56: It has been conveyed by a succession (of teachers):
pli-tv-pvr1.1:4.4: these in the glorious (is)land of Jambusiri. /
pli-tv-pvr1.1:6.1: These great beings, of great wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:7.1: They also taught the five Nikāyas
pli-tv-pvr1.1:11.2: and Rohaṇa revered by the virtuous,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:11.3: His pupil named Khema of great wisdom and learned in the Three Piṭakas, /
pli-tv-pvr1.1:12.1: Who in his wisdom shone with great splendour in the island like the king of stars,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:13.2: he of great learning named Puppha,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:13.4: skilful in all the contents of the Piṭaka, /
pli-tv-pvr1.1:14.4: skilled in the tradition of the True _Dhamma_, /
pli-tv-pvr1.1:15.2: skilled in all the contents of the Piṭaka,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:16.2: of great wisdom and much learning
pli-tv-pvr1.1:17.4: skilled in the tradition of the True _Dhamma_, /
pli-tv-pvr1.1:18.4: skilled in all the contents of the Vinaya. /
pli-tv-pvr1.1:19.1: These sinless sages of great wisdom,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:19.2: knowing the Vinaya and skilled in the Way,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:19.3: Proclaimed the Vinaya-piṭaka in the Island of Tambapaṇṇi. [1]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.1: “Where was that which is the second offence involving Defeat laid down by that Lord who knows …?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.2: It was laid down in Rājagaha.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.6: On the subject of Dhaniya the potter’s son taking pieces of wood belonging to the king when they had not been given to him.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.7: There is one laying down, one supplementary laying down.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.8: “Of the six origins of offences by how many origins does (a monk) originate (the offence)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.9: He originates it by three origins—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.10: it may be that he originates it by body and by mind, not by speech;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.11: it may be that he originates it by speech and by mind, not by body;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.12: it may be that he originates it by body and by speech and by mind. [2]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.1: “Where was that which is the third offence involving Defeat laid down …?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.2: It was laid down in Vesālī.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.6: On the subject of several monks depriving one another of life.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.7: There is one laying down, one supplementary laying down.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.12: it may be that he originates it by body and by speech and by mind. [3]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.1: “Where was that which is the fourth offence involving Defeat laid down …?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.2: It was laid down in Vesālī.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.4: Concerning monks on the banks of the river Vaggumudā.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.6: On the subject of the monks on the banks of the Vaggumudā speaking praise of each other’s state of further-men in front of householders.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.7: There is one laying down, one supplementary laying down.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.12: it may be that he originates it by body and by speech and by mind. [4]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:23.1: Concluded are the four Offences involving Defeat
pli-tv-pvr1.1:25.1: Unchastity, taking what is not given,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:25.2: and the form of men, those who are further—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:25.4: without doubt (concern men who) must be destroyed.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.1: Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down by that Lord who knows, who sees, perfected one, fully Self-Awakened One, for the emission of semen using (the hand)?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.11: A laying down (that holds good) everywhere.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.12: “A laying down that is shared, a laying down that is not shared?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.13: A laying down that is not shared.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.14: “A laying down for one (Order), a laying down for both (Orders)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.17: Plunged into the source, included in the source.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.19: By the third recital one comes to the recital.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.21: The falling away in moral habit.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.25: He originates it by one origin—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.26: he originates it by body and by mind, not by speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.30: It is stopped by two decidings:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.42: “Conditioned by how many reasons was the offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down by the Lord for the emission of semen using (the hand)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.43: Conditioned by ten reasons was the offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down by the Lord for the emission of semen using (the hand):
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.44: for the excellence of the Order…for help with Discipline.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.1: “Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down by that Lord who knows, who sees, perfected one, fully Self-Awakened One, for the coming into physical contact with a woman?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.11: it may be that he originates it by body and by speech, not by mind;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.14: it may be that he originates it by body and by speech and by mind. [5]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.1: “Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down…for begging for having a hut built for oneself?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.6: On the subject of the monks of Āḷavī begging for having a hut built for themselves…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.8: He originates it by six origins…(_see_ Prv 1.1:Bu-Ss 5). [6]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.2: It was laid down at Kosambī…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.6: The venerable Channa, clearing a site for a _vihāra_, had a tree that was used as a shrine cut down…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.8: He originates it by six origins…[7]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.1: “Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down…for defaming a monk with an unfounded charge of an offence involving Defeat?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.2: It was laid down in Rājagaha…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.4: Concerning the monks who were followers of Mettiya and Bhummajaka…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.6: The monks who were the followers of Mettiya and Bhummajaka defamed the venerable Dabba the Mallian with an unfounded charge of an offence involving Defeat…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.8: He originates it by three origins…[8]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.4: Concerning the monks who were the followers of Mettiya and Bhummajaka…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.6: The monks who were the followers of Mettiya and Bhummajaka defamed the venerable Dabba the Mallian…really belonging to something else…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.8: He originates it by three origins…[9]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.1: “Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down…for admonishing up to three times a schismatic monk for not giving up (his course)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.2: It was laid down in Rājagaha…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.6: Devadatta went forward with a schism of an Order that was harmonious…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.8: He originates it by one origin—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.9: he originates it by body and by speech and by mind…[10]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.1: “Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down…for admonishing up to three times monks who were throwing in their lot with a schism for not giving up (their course)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.2: It was laid down in Rājagaha…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.6: Several monks were throwing in their lot with and taking part in Devadatta’s proceeding for a schism in the Order…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.1: “Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down…for admonishing up to three times a monk who was difficult to speak to for not giving up (his course)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.2: It was laid down in Kosambī…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.6: When the venerable Channa was being spoken to by monks according to _Dhamma_ he reckoned himself as one not to be spoken to…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.1: “Where was that offence requiring a Formal Meeting of the Order laid down…for admonishing up to three times a monk who brought a family into disrepute for not giving up (his course)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.2: It was laid down in Sāvatthī…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.4: Concerning the monks who were the followers of Assaji and Punabbasu…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.6: Monks, through the Order, carried out the act of banishment against the monks who were followers of Assaji and Punabbasu and goers on a wrong course through partiality, goers on a wrong course through hatred, goers on a wrong course through confusion, goers on a wrong course through fear so as to disgrace them…

pli-tv-pvr1.1:58.2: lewd talk, and one’s own pleasure,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.2: It was laid down in Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.20: “Of the four fallings away which falling away?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.22: “Of the seven classes of offence which class of offence?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.24: “Of the six origins of offences by how many origins does (a monk) originate (the offence)?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.25: He originates it by one origin—

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.31: it may be by a verdict in the presence of and by the carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, it may be by a verdict in the presence of and by the covering over (as) with grass…

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.43: Conditioned by ten reasons was the first Undetermined offence laid down by the Lord:
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.44: for the excellence of the Order…for help with Discipline.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.6: Several monks, having accepted robe-material not at a right time, exceeded the month…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.7: One laying down, one supplementary laying down.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:85.6: The venerable Udāyi had a soiled robe washed by a nun who was not a relation…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:85.8: Of the six origins of offences he originates it by six origins. [4]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:86.8: He originates it by six origins. [5]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:87.8: He originates it by six origins. [6]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:88.8: He originates it by six origins. [7]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:90.1: “…involving Forfeiture laid down for one who, before being invited, approaches householders who are not relations (of his) and puts forward a consideration with regard to a robe?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:90.8: He originates it by six origins. [9]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.4: Concerning the venerable Upananda the Sakyan…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.6: The venerable Upananda the Sakyan, on being told by a lay-follower, “Wait this one day (only), revered sir,” did not wait…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.9: He originates it by six origins. [10]
pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.1: “…involving Forfeiture laid down for one who has a rug made mixed with silk?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.4: Concerning the group of six monks…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.6: The group of six monks, having approached silk-makers, spoke thus: “Sirs, hatch many silk-worms,
pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.8: for we want to make a rug mixed with silk”…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.10: He originates it by six origins. [11]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:94.8: He originates it by six origins. [12]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.4: Concerning the group of six monks…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.6: The group of six monks, taking only a little white for the seam, all the same had a rug made of pure black sheep’s wool…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.8: He originates it by six origins. [13]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.7: One laying down, one supplementary laying down…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.8: He originates it by six origins. [14]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.2: It was laid down in Sāvatthī…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.6: Several monks, discarding their rugs, took upon themselves the practice of forest-dwellers, the practice of almsmen, the practice of those who wear rag-robes…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.8: He originates it by six origins. [15]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.8: He originates it by two origins:
pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.9: it may be that he originates it by body, not by speech, not by mind;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.10: it may be that he originates it by body and by mind, not by speech. [16]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.2: It was laid down among the Sakyans…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.4: Concerning the group of six monks…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.6: The group of six monks had sheep’s wool washed by nuns who were not relations…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.8: He originates it by six origins. [17]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:100.4: Concerning the venerable Upananda the Sakyan…

pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.4: Concerning the group of six monks…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.6: The group of six monks engaged in various transactions in which gold and silver were used…
pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.8: He originates it by six origins. [19]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:116.1: Ten (nights), one night, and a month,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.6: On the subject of Hatthaka the Sakyan who, when he was talking with followers of other sects, having denied, acknowledged, and having acknowledged, denied.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.8: Of the six origins of offences he originates (the offence) by three origins:
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.9: it may be that he originates it by body and by mind, not by speech;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.10: it may be that he originates it by speech and by mind, not by body;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.11: it may be that he originates it by body and by speech and by mind. [1]

pli-tv-pvr1.1:120.6: The group of six monks, quarrelling with well behaved monks, insulted the well behaved monks…
